channel.title: Dave's linkblog feed
channel.description: My linkblog has been around in various locations for many years.

item.description: Journalists: "He's lying again" isn't news.
item.source:markdown: Journalists: "He's lying again" isn't news.

item.description: If Trump is GOP anomaly, why are the denunciations from Republican leaders so soft and mealy-mouthed?
item.source:markdown: If Trump is GOP anomaly, why are the denunciations from Republican leaders so soft and mealy-mouthed?

item.description: Please be kind, but wtf is block-based design? Explain it slowly as a person who loves blogging and has been making software for blogging for almost 30 years. I don't know what you all mean. Also I'm a writer too. :-)
item.source:markdown: Please be kind, but wtf is block-based design? Explain it slowly as a person who loves blogging and has been making software for blogging for almost 30 years. I don't know what you all mean. Also I'm a writer too. :-)

item.description: I agree we shouldn't demean Trump voters. As long as we're all Americans. We should help each other.
item.source:markdown: I agree we shouldn't demean Trump voters. As long as we're all Americans. We should help each other.

item.description: 2024 Emmy Nominations: Full List of Nominees.
item.source:markdown: 2024 Emmy Nominations: Full List of Nominees.

item.description: Could we agree that ChatGPT can ingest everything that's in Wikipedia? I particularly want the images. I'd like to ask for a picture of Chuck Berry, and be able to put him in a scene with the Wordle Kitty. That seems pretty harmless. The news industry could hardly object.
item.source:markdown: Could we agree that ChatGPT can ingest everything that's in Wikipedia? I particularly want the images. I'd like to ask for a picture of Chuck Berry, and be able to put him in a scene with the Wordle Kitty. That seems pretty harmless. The news industry could hardly object.

item.description: These two friends built a simple tool to transfer playlists between Apple Music and Spotify, and it works great.
item.source:markdown: These two friends built a simple tool to transfer playlists between Apple Music and Spotify, and it works great.

item.description: How to avoid sanewashing Trump.
item.source:markdown: How to avoid sanewashing Trump.

item.description: They should create their own AI systems the same way they should’ve made their own twitters. They keep letting tech own their distribution, and then appeal to government to save them. They could instead make the products people want.
item.source:markdown: They should create their own AI systems the same way they should’ve made their own twitters. They keep letting tech own their distribution, and then appeal to government to save them. They could instead make the products people want.

item.description: We didn’t need to ask Redmond or Cupertino for permission to exist. No one was forcing any of us to use their server, their client, or their operating system.
item.source:markdown: We didn’t need to ask Redmond or Cupertino for permission to exist. No one was forcing any of us to use their server, their client, or their operating system.

item.description: Laura Loomer.
item.source:markdown: Laura Loomer.

item.description: Why The Atlantic’s Critique of Sanewashing Doesn't Hold Up.

item.description: Harris drops powerful new ad slamming Trump’s abortion extremism.
item.source:markdown: Harris drops powerful new ad slamming Trump’s abortion extremism.

item.description: Show notes for a short podcast I recorded on this day in 2004, a response to Adam's podcast which I had just listened to. These were the good days, a new medium in its early stages of booting up, after years of trying to get it to go.
item.source:markdown: Show notes for a short podcast I recorded on this day in 2004, a response to Adam's podcast which I had just listened to. These were the good days, a new medium in its early stages of booting up, after years of trying to get it to go.

item.description: Scripting News: Dropbox almost reinvented the web.
item.source:markdown: Scripting News: Dropbox almost reinvented the web.

item.description: Hmm as I recall four years ago Trump stayed in his PJs all day at the White House watching Fox News except maybe playing golf some days.
item.source:markdown: Hmm as I recall four years ago Trump stayed in his PJs all day at the White House watching Fox News except maybe playing golf some days.

item.description: Trump’s Slow-Burn Authoritarianism.
item.source:markdown: Trump’s Slow-Burn Authoritarianism.

item.description: A thread on Mastodon where I explain to Miguel de Icaza, a longtime developer friend, how Dropbox had the vision to turn the web into a fantastic file system for work and publishing. I made a product for it called Fargo.
item.source:markdown: A thread on Mastodon where I explain to Miguel de Icaza, a longtime developer friend, how Dropbox had the vision to turn the web into a fantastic file system for work and publishing. I made a product for it called Fargo.

item.description: Google Trends for "sanewashing."
item.source:markdown: Google Trends for "sanewashing."

item.description: Paul Krugman: "Trump didn’t have a bad night. This is just who he is, and has been all along, visible to anyone who looked past the sanewashing."
item.source:markdown: Paul Krugman: "Trump didn’t have a bad night. This is just who he is, and has been all along, visible to anyone who looked past the sanewashing."

item.description: Harris was prepared.
item.source:markdown: Harris was prepared.

item.description: What Harris appeared to understand, better than anyone else who has debated Trump, is that the key to defeating him is to trigger him psychologically.
item.source:markdown: What Harris appeared to understand, better than anyone else who has debated Trump, is that the key to defeating him is to trigger him psychologically.

item.description: Highly recommend this New Yorker podcast episode to understand why political reporters are so out of step with the people who read their stuff. They are unable to be revulsed by the things Trump says. Listen to it the way we listen to Trump supporters in Ohio diners. They are a foreign culture. That's not good.
item.source:markdown: Highly recommend this New Yorker podcast episode to understand why political reporters are so out of step with the people who read their stuff. They are unable to be revulsed by the things Trump says. Listen to it the way we listen to Trump supporters in Ohio diners. They are a foreign culture. That's not good.
